newsitem.title: FRANCE: Euro-Council raps members record on human rights.
newsitem.headline: Euro-Council raps members record on human rights.

text.p: The Council of Europe, which safeguards democracy and human rights, on Tuesday criticised several members including the Ukraine and Russia for their records on capital punishment.

In a statement coinciding with world Human Rights Day, Leni Fischer, speaker of the Council's parliamentary assembly, highlighted executions in the Ukraine, which joined in November 1995, and Russia, which joined in February of this year.
"In joining the Council of Europe, Russia and Ukraine had pledged to immediately launch a moratorium on executions. But the pace of executions is more frenetic than before," Fischer said.
According to figures published by the Council, 89 people were executed in Ukraine in the first half of this year, and 79 in Russia.

Fischer also urged Croatia, a member since last month, to respect its commitments on the freedom of the press, and called on non-members Belarus and the Yugoslav Federal Republic to boost respect of democratic values.
